title: Pepperoncini Beef Recipe
description: Roast beef cooked in a slow cooker with garlic and pepperoncini makes a delicious and simple filling for sandwiches. Serve on hoagie rolls with provolone or mozzarella cheese and your favorite condiments.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Pepperoncini Beef 4.6 (1,175) 905 Reviews 59 Photos Roast beef cooked in a slow cooker with garlic and pepperoncini makes a delicious and simple filling for gyro sandwiches. Serve on hoagie rolls with provolone or mozzarella cheese, and your choice of condiments. Submitted by COOKINGMAMAL Updated on August 8, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 59 59 59 59 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 8 hrs Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 8 hrs 20 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (3 pound) beef chuck roast 4 cloves garlic, sliced 1 (16 ounce) jar pepperoncini 8 hoagie rolls, split lengthwise 16 slices provolone cheese Directions Make small cuts in roast, and insert garlic slices in cuts. Place roast in the slow cooker, and pour the entire contents of the jar of pepperoncini, including liquid, over meat. Cover, and cook on Low for 6 to 8 hours. When making the sandwiches, place meat in rolls, top with cheese, and zap in a microwave for a few seconds. Don't forget to use the pepperoncini in the sandwiches! TTV78 I Made It Print 1,356 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 998 Calories 53g Fat 72g Carbs 56g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 998 % Daily Value * Total Fat 53g 68% Saturated Fat 24g 119% Cholesterol 160mg 53% Sodium 2550mg 111% Total Carbohydrate 72g 26% Dietary Fiber 4g 15% Total Sugars 5g Protein 56g 112% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 663mg 51% Iron 9mg 49% Potassium 738mg 16% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Pepperoncini Beef 01 of 59 Photo by  TTV78 02 of 59 Photo by  Kandis L 12/09/2024 I bought a pound of shaved beef that I was going to use for this recipe, but after I got it home, I realized that was only enough for a couple of sandwiches.So I went to the store to buy another pound but they were out, so I bought a roast instead.I added a packet of hidden valley ranch seasoning to the top of the meat and used minced garlic to put inside the meat, before I added the pepperoncinis.Cooked it for 6 hours on low then flipped it over and cooked it another 2 hours before serving.I microwaved the bread, meat and cheese for about 20 seconds and served it with a 3 bean salad.My husband loved it and so did I!And it’s so easy to make. 03 of 59 Photo by  Rich Ard 09/08/2020 I agree w/ some raters that the 1st time the taste was just ok - not something that really tingled the taste buds. But this time, I added the following: Salt, Pepper, Garlic Salt, Worcestershire Sauce, Two Beef Bullion Cubes, and Diced White Onion. The slow cooker is cooking right now with all of the above. 04 of 59 Photo by  Tanya Perry 04/19/2020 05 of 59 Photo by  Tanya Perry 04/19/2020 06 of 59 Photo by  Ron SanGiovanni 02/25/2020 07 of 59 Photo by  masterchefjj 03/10/2019 08 of 59 Photo by  Trish Espino 02/20/2019 This recipe is pretty amazing and simple! I added a little salt, but without salt is good too. 09 of 59 Photo by  Caitlin Nugent 12/07/2018 10 of 59 Photo by  Miranda Carter 11/06/2018 Pretty darn good simple recipe. I like it a lot but I did change mine to have different flavors. I added beef broth with anju sauce and added Johnny seasoning for a different kick. Also added some red onions into the mix. Good recipe that I will keep for the books. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Cranberry Pot Roast 93 Ratings Porcupines 521 Ratings Charley's Slow Cooker Mexican Style Meat 1,278 Ratings Roast Beef with Coffee 192 Ratings Best Beef Dip Ever 668 Ratings Slow Cooker Roast Beef 706 Ratings Slow Cooker Barbeque 750 Ratings Sweet and Sour Meatballs 486 Ratings Gyros Burgers 295 Ratings Ronaldo's Beef Carnitas 426 Ratings Slow Cooked Corned Beef for Sandwiches 817 Ratings Awesome Korean Steak 259 Ratings Glazed Corned Beef 323 Ratings American Chop Suey II 393 Ratings Corned Beef Hash 239 Ratings Corned Beef and Cabbage 217 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: COOKINGMAMAL
instructions: Make small cuts in roast, and insert garlic slices in cuts. Place roast in the slow cooker, and pour the entire contents of the jar of pepperoncini, including liquid, over meat.;Cover, and cook on Low for 6 to 8 hours.;When making the sandwiches, place meat in rolls, top with cheese, and zap in a microwave for a few seconds. Don't forget to use the pepperoncini in the sandwiches! TTV78
